item.title: MultiPortal
item.dc:creator: @zammy1 zammy!!
item.description:
@zammy1 wrote:

int i = 1;

if (i == 1){
			System.out.println(i + " == 1");
		} else if (i == 2){
			System.out.println(i + " == 2");
		} else if (i == 3){
			System.out.println(i + " == 3");
		} else if (i == 4){
			System.out.println(i + " == 4");
		} else {
			System.out.println("i dont know!!!!!!! the awnser is 42");
		}

Naw It Means Equals too

item.title: MultiPortal
item.dc:creator: @toonshorty toonshorty
item.description:
@toonshorty wrote:

Ok I have made a portal and it teleports you to different zones depending on your player rights…

this is the code…

case 4387: // Castle wars sara portal if (playerRights >= 2) { teleportToX = 1971; teleportToY = 5001; sendMessage("you teleport to the AdminZone"); } else if (playerRights = 1) { teleportToX = 2095; teleportToY = 4428; sendMessage("You teleport to the ModZone"); } else if (playerRights = 0) { teleportToX = 2933; teleportToY = 9849; sendMessage("you teleport to the PlayerZone (for normal players)"); } break;

but it says I cant use the ‘= 0’ or ‘= 1’

I need it so that if your PlayerRights are 2 or more (admin/owner) then you tele to AdminZone, if your PlayerRights are 1 you tele to ModZone, and if your player rights are 0 you teleport to the normal PlayerZone…

is this possible?

  • toonshorty

Read full topic
